page.title: 05OUR WALK
page.content: Who can deny the beauty of Glyn Y Mel,<The Vale of Honey>? What beckoning finger directs me to the heart of the wood that is never sunny, With deadly silence but for the ripple of the stream, In the darkness the little fish grow bolder, Beauty is in the eyes of the beholder The marble headstones lie scattered in the mansion grounds so fine, they remind me of all the faithful animals that are now lost in time. There where the willow lifts its drooping head, A modest stone proclaims poor Lucy's bed. Little streams along the way meander into one The tall trees in forty shades of
